text: Late to the party but we have also been experiencing the delay issue when updating CSS and JS files.
<@U26D0TF8E> how long is your delay?
it has been ranging from a few minutes to a couple of hours
sometimes it is immediate...I will try to keep better track of when we experience the issue and let you know
That is weird. It should updates in at most a few seconds. Do you have a specific file that can be reproducible?
not at this time...it has been happening randomly but I will provide one the next time it happens
Sounds good. Let me know if you can reproduce this.

What mvillalobos experienced does line up with what we've been seeing. It doesn't happen all the time, it seems to happen at random, but when it does occur it will continue to do so for awhile.

I don't think in our experience that it tends to last much more than an hour, but it definitely has taken a long time before.
Will let you know right away when we encounter the issue next

I had this issue last Thursday with a site, same situation, files were not edited in over a year. The issue was related to the pre-processor. I believe an update was made to the pre-processor used for CSS files and that made it's "rules" more specific.

In my case I found the problem by inspecting the page, going into the linked stylesheet, finding where the stylesheet ended - the stylesheet was incomplete at an @supports declaration.

The issue came down to the pre-processor not liking that I didn't have a space in between an or condition in the supports query.

Web browsers don't care about the space, and the pre-processor didn't previously care either.

Either way adding the space fixed the issue for me.

Hey Jon, Yes got it Libo Song helped me out - It was a pre-processing issue. In the template preview on HubSpot the CSS isn't pre-processed which is why it didn't show on the template preview only the live website.
does anyone have experience with single sign on and login functionality? we are trying to find a way to have a login on HS pages that connects to an external CRM
can you submit the login form to the url that is in the CRM login ?
I think the issue we are running into is that (according to the client) the query needs to run through the site
we've submitted that way before but for some reason with this particular CRM (MemberMax) we are being told it can't just be submitted...it has to pass the query
When editing custom modules, the 3 inputs (HTML + HUBL, CSS and JS) aren't being populated.
<@U7VHJ9ZFT> This should be working now
Are you able to share what you are trying to do with teh url and what exactly isn't working?
Can you provide some more information as to what you are doing and what is going on?

Does anyone have any experience using jquery data elements in a custom template? Example, this line of code should generate a looping video BG: 

<video class="video-bg" data-video="https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hubfs/697792/CAL-SITE-2017/video-library/fpo.mp4" autoplay muted loop poster="assets/videos/testimonials.jpg" style="background-image:url(assets/videos/testimonials.jpg);"> </video> 

However, it is getting tripped up on the “data-video” portion. If changed to src=”…” it recognizes the video, but loses all styling. My guess is that HubSpot is running a different version of jquery.

Thanks!
Do you have link where we can look at it? Also, just curious, why are you using a data attribute and not src?
yeah, do you load teh video into the src with jquery?
what styling are you referring to, also

<@U2H3TT8F2> <@U25PYL3Q8> thanks for quick response – unfortunately, I am not up an running on a stage site yet, but I can provide screenshots. Essentially, when I switch it to "src" it is losing it's full size styling. The video is no longer 'cover' size, and it scales down when the screen size scales down... Not sure if this is caused by using src, or is another issue in itself. Screenshots coming.
scaled down video underneath overlay, when using "src" as opposed to data attribute
most i could find that may be able to help you is this article here: <http://thenewcode.com/777/Create-Fullscreen-HTML5-Page-Background-Video>
When using an SVG in content settings for the logo - the emails go out with an SVG, and the logo doesn't show up -- what can we do about this??
can you change the template to use the logo module and then override the logo with png of it?

only other way would be if HS add's another "Logo" area in the email content settings and then pulls from this for emails by default (which seems like a good idea since SVG is a better option when using logo on the web

Right -- So this is more of a question for HS to address. Why allow SVG when emails don't send out properly. There is no warning. Seems HS should put something kind of warning in there. Or automate the SVG to png for email.
thanks!
Does HS have a media/press portal where we can download screen shots of products?

I’d recommend just grabbing screenshots from respective product pages <@U2H3TT8F2>. For example, for Workflows you could grab screenshots here: <https://www.HubSpot.com/products/marketing/marketing-automation>. I’m happy to help get you any you need as well.
